text: Union Station is a provincial electoral district (riding) in the Canadian province of Manitoba that was first contested at the 2019 Manitoba general election. Uzoma Asagwara was elected its first representative to the Legislative Assembly of Manitoba. The riding was created by the 2018 provincial redistribution out of parts of Logan, Wolseley and Minto. The riding contains most of Downtown Winnipeg and parts of the neighbourhoods of West Broadway and Spence. The riding is presumably named for Union Station and according to the boundaries commission "to recognize the important role of the railway in the establishment of Winnipeg". ==Election results== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" | 2016 provincial election redistributed results |- ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="130px" colspan="2" | Party ! bgcolor="#DDDDFF" width="30px" | % |- | | | New Democratic ||align=right| 39.9 |- | | | Liberal ||align=right| 22.8 |- | | | Progressive Conservative ||align=right| 19.6 |- | | | Green ||align=right| 14.2 |- | | | Others ||align=right| 3.5 |} ==References== Category:Manitoba provincial electoral districts Category:Politics of Winnipeg
title: Union Station (electoral district)
